Method Detail

connect

public void connect(java.lang.String moduleName)
             throws SBWCommunicationException,
                    SBWBrokerStartException
Connect to the SBW Broker running on the current host computer. The argument is a unique module name; if empty or null, it signifies that the module will not provide services to SBW. (In effect, it will act as an "anonymous" module.)

Parameters:
moduleName - a string that identifies this module
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if any problems arise while attempting to connect to the Broker.

connect

public void connect(java.lang.String moduleName,
                    java.lang.String hostName)
             throws SBWCommunicationException,
                    SBWBrokerStartException
Connect to the SBW Broker running on the specified host computer. The first argument is a unique module name; if empty or null, it signifies that the module will not provide services to SBW. (In effect, it will act as an "anonymous" module.) The second argument is the target hostname.

Parameters:
moduleName - a string that identifies this module
hostName - the name of the host running the SBW Broker
Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if any problems arise while attempting to connect to the Broker.

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Returns true if the module is connected to the Broker.

Returns:
boolean true if the module is connected to the Broker

disconnect

public void disconnect()
                throws SBWCommunicationException
Handles the work of disconnecting from the Broker. This includes sending a disconnect message to the Broker, closing the sockets and terminating the receiver thread.

Throws:
SBWCommunicationException - if a problem occurs while trying to disconnect from the Broker

getServiceId

public int getServiceId(int moduleId,
                        java.lang.String serviceName)
                 throws SBWException
Given a module's numeric identifier and the name of a service, this method returns the numeric service identifier. This is achieved by contacting the module directly. The SBW Broker purposefully does not cache this information to avoid the risk of having the information fall out of date.

Applications should not store numeric service identifiers beyond the duration of a single session with SBW. A module may be updated or otherwise changed in-between sessions, and the correspondence between services and their identifiers may be reassigned by the module. A client should always obtain the service identifiers afresh in each new session.

Parameters:
moduleId - the integer identifier of the module
serviceName - the name of the service
Returns:
the integer identifier of the service
Throws:
SBWException - if an error occurs in contacting the SBW Broker or the module

getMethodId

public int getMethodId(int moduleId,
                       int serviceId,
                       java.lang.String signatureString)
                throws SBWException
Given a module's numeric identifier, a service identifier, and a method's signature string, this method returns the numeric method identifier. This is achieved by contacting the module directly. The SBW Broker purposefully does not cache this information to avoid the risk of having the information fall out of date.

The same warnings apply as for service identifiers: applications should not store numeric method identifiers beyond the duration of a single session with SBW. A module may be updated or otherwise changed in-between sessions, and the correspondence between methods and their identifiers may be reassigned by the module. A client should always obtain the method identifiers anew in each new session.

Parameters:
moduleId - the numeric identifier of the module
serviceId - the numeric identifier of the service
signatureString - the string signature of the sought-after method
Returns:
the integer identifier of the method
Throws:
SBWException - if an error occurs in contacting the SBW Broker or the module

getThisModule

public int getThisModule()
                  throws SBWException
Returns the numeric identifier for the currently-executing module.

Returns:
the numeric identifier of the current module
Throws:
SBWException - if an error occurs in contacting the SBW Broker

call

public DataBlockReader call(int moduleTo,
                            int service,
                            int method,
                            DataBlockWriter args)
                     throws SBWException
Handles "call" operations: invokes the given method of the given service on the given module, and blocks until the method has completed and returned a value. The return value is in the form of a DataBlockReader messaging primitive.

Parameters:
moduleTo - the id of the module to which to send the message
service - the id of the service to invoke
method - the id of the method to invoke
args - the DataBlockWriter containing the payload of the message
Returns:
DataBlockReader the message body returned from the call
Throws:
SBWException - if any problems occurred during the call
See Also:
send(int, int, int, edu.caltech.sbw.DataBlockWriter)

send

public void send(int moduleTo,
                 int service,
                 int method,
                 DataBlockWriter args)
          throws SBWCommunicationException

registerReceiver

public void registerReceiver(Receiver rec)
